newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Blast kills Kazakh shepherd on Soviet missile site.
newsitem.headline: Blast kills Kazakh shepherd on Soviet missile site.

text.p: A shepherd tending his flock was killed in an explosion at a Soviet weapons test site in Kazakhstan on Wednesday, the Kazakh state emergency situations committee said on Thursday.
A spokeswoman said the man had kindled a fire near a wrecked military aircraft on the Kapustin Yar test range and was killed when the fire detonated the plane's unexploded ammunition.

The Kapustin Yar test sites, inherited by Kazakhstan on the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991 and rented back to Moscow, stretch for hundreds of kilometres (miles) across barren steppe in western and central Kazakhstan.
Russia uses Kapustin Yar for testing missiles and aircraft.
Earlier this year the Central Asian state's parliament appealed to Kazakh President Nursultan Nazarbayev to close the test sites, saying they were harmful to both nature and people.
